bug.short_desc: provide explicit targets for each repository

long_desc.thetext: The snapshot builds use implicit targets. This can cause builds to consume different versions of libraries or dependencies that are not listed in the release targets or violate the dependency structure. To ensure that all builds use the same set of dependencies all builds should use explicit targets.

These reviews add explicit targets for contexts and tasks:
12247: 406695: provide explicit targets for tasks build [I7c95dafb] https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/12247/
12277: 406695: provide explicit targets for context builds [Ie34d2563] https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/12277/
To run a build use "-Pstrict -Dexplicit-target". I didn't find a way to make that the default without making larger updates to the existing build infrastructure so for now explicit targets still need to be enabled explicitly.
I'll change gerrit trigger builds to use the explicit targets where available.
I don't plan on doing further work on this. Feel free to re-open to apply the same change for other sub projects.

Per the discussion on bug 428132 we should consider doing this for all repositories. I am very reluctant though given the overhead of managing so many targets, especially when updating them means pushing reviews to 9 different repositories.

(In reply to comment #4) > Per the discussion on bug 428132 we should consider doing this for all > repositories. I am very reluctant though given the overhead of managing so many > targets, especially when updating them means pushing reviews to 9 different > repositories.
Maybe we can use one target for all repositories (mylyn-bootstrap-e4.4.target or a modified copy).
Thoughts?

Neither the tasks nor the context target even resolve (because nobody has updated them in a long time), which leads me to wonder if they are actually being used by the builds.
I am not sure whether it makes sense for all repositories to use the same targets, but maybe we could at least keep them all in org.eclipse.mylyn-target to make updating them easier.

From bug 428132, it sounds like component builds may not always build against the latest without explicit targets. Nevertheless I am moving this to the backlog due to lack of capacity to create or maintain these targets.
